reviewText:
One of the better platformers of the early 1990's.

The later episodes get pretty difficult.

Spent dozens of hours of playing Cosmo's Cosmic Adventures when it first came out.

10/10 - this finally came to Steam.

reviewText:

reviewText: 6/10\n\nNot exactly one of Apogee's best games, specially with its clunky jumping and some very frustrating levels. However, even despite that, the game is still a classic Apogee platformer and quite fun to play. The story is pretty cute and the Duke Nukem cameo on episode 2 is a bonus.
voteText: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful

reviewText: One of my favorites as a kid.  Colorful and nostalgic!
voteText: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
Cosmo's Cosmic Adventure came out when I was but a toddler. My dad had the game, and when I got old enough I played it all the time, along with Commander Keen.

I'll try not to spoil it, but Cosmo ends with a cliff hanger. On and off over the years, I've searched for the second game to find out what happened next. It's been two decades, but I finally found it here. This game comes with all three episodes! It's a childhood dream come true!

Haven't played more than a couple levels of the second episode so far, but it made me so happy to find out what happened after the end of the first episode. Also, the first episode was definitely worth the nostalgia trip!
voteText: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful

reviewText: just got this and yes have only played 11 minutes but i got this for the memories it invokes and the funny thing about it is i was only thinking of this game last week.Now if you have never played it  you will be disappointed if you think it is a graphic powerhouse remember these games were made before graphics were really important.Yes it's not super hard but there is no quicksave or anything like that so if you die before you get to a certain place in the game back to the start you go.One thing i always remember about these games or anything from the past we wouldn't have what have now so always be gratful and i was 35 when i got this hence the memories for me but try it is fun AND it worked for me with a controller.
voteText: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
Brings back the old days playing this game on my 386 PC.
Love that someone revived this game for modern computers.

Why is this 800mb download when this game used to be on one 3.25 floppy disk. Even if it is the three chapters, 3 x 1.44MB = 4.32MB. WTH is this over 800MB then.
voteText: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful

reviewText: Another game that did not stand up to the test of time.  Buy for nostalgia, but if you've never heard of it, skip it.
voteText: 2 of 7 people (29%) found this review helpful 1 person found this review funny

reviewText: Nostalgia be damned, this game is objectively bad. Clunky controls, absolutely tiny view size, choppy graphics, this is one of those games that was acceptable as a kid simply because you had nothing else. Thank goodness games have evolved.
voteText: 5 of 18 people (28%) found this review helpful 1 person found this review funny

reviewText:
One of the more disappointing Apogee games.

The intro steals the ZZ-Top in its own DOS render, but the rest of the music is irrating and repetitive.
The gameplay is so jittery. The movent and scrolling feels like 2 frames per second it's hard to see what the f*ck is going on.
CTRL to jump and ALT to take a sh*t, basically you run through levels collecting points and jumping on enemies heads. Sounds like Mario, but Mario is 100000 time better.

Meh.

2/10
voteText: 1 of 15 people (7%) found this review helpful 1 person found this review funny

reviewText: Another one of those old platformers. Jump on enemies to kill them. You can also find and use bombs. Collect fruit, stars and other things for higher score. There are also items that increase your health. You can also climb walls by getting stuck to them (jump near walls and press left or right arrow).\n\nNot bad, but could be better.
voteText: No ratings yet

reviewText:
The early 90's are back! This game is great. Smooth controls and good music. Plenty of levels to keep you entertained for the cost.

Music and sound: 9/10
Visuals: 9/10

It seems to have lasted this long for a reason. Sound and visuals get high rating because they out-perform other games from that era that are also available on Steam (check out some of my other reviews.)

Here is a bit of gameplay:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=zTSmjT50C6M
